page.title: 09REDESMOUTH
page.content: Redesmouth is a{hamlet}about two miles from Bellingham. It is so called because the River Rede meets the River North Tyne here. There are twenty two{houses}all of these except one were owned by the railway.They were built for railway } workers. It used to be a very busy place because two railway lines met here.Children from Bellingham used to come on the train for a penny,run across the bridge and go back with the new driver who changed trains at Redesmouth. The lines and bridge have gone but the station,signal box,turntable, platform and engine sheds can still be seen although they are now used by the farmer. Now it is a quiet place where people can enjoy the footpaths and scenery.
